page.title: 08The Chew Valley Bed Race
page.content: The Bed Race is an annual event organised by Chew Valley Round Table. The Race is around the Chew Valley Lake and goes through the area. Men and women run round the lake pushing beds with steering wheels attached. Sometimes, people dress up in funny costumes and decorate their beds. In the weeks leading up to the race, the competitors get people to sponsor them. It raises about Â£10,000 each year and all the money goes to charity. The course is about 10 miles long and goes through surrounding villages whilst going round the lake. Lots of people turn out for the occasion and a tradition is squirting water and throwing flour at them. Hundreds of people compete and it is very enjoyable.
